text.title: Wikinews interviews Dr Clive Hamilton about the upcoming by-election in the Higgins electorate of the Australian parliament

head.s: Wikinews interviews Dr Clive Hamilton about the upcoming by-election in the Higgins electorate of the Australian parliament

text.p:
With two
by-elections
coming up in
Australia
, many minor parties and independents will be looking to gain a seat in the House of Representatives .
Dr Clive Hamilton
AM
is one of the independents / candidate for the Australian Greens .

p.s: Dr Hamilton was awarded Member of the Order of Australia honours for his contributions to public debate and public policy earlier this year .

Wikinews reporter
Patrick Gillett
held an exclusive email interview with Dr Hamilton , candidate for the
Division of Higgins
.
In participating in this interview , Dr Hamilton was about to fly out to a function .

p.hi: Why do you want to get into parliament ?

p.s: The main reason for standing as the Greens candidate for Higgins is that I am extremely worried about climate change .
The future of our children is at stake yet the main political parties seem more interested in appeasing the fossil fuel lobby .

p.hi: Why do you represent your party ?

p.s: The Greens policy on climate change is the only one that is based on what the climate scientists are convinced we need to do .

p.hi: What would the three main policies you are taking into this by-election be ?

p.s: Climate change policy , asylum seekers and work-life balance .

p.hi: How would you address these policies ?

p.s: The Greens have strong policies in these areas .

p.hi: Sending asylum seekers to Indonesia : good or bad ?

p.s: We have a legal and moral obligation to land asylum seekers in Australia if they are found in Australian waters , then to quickly assess their claims .
Sending them to Indonesian camps is inhumane , as anyone who knows anything about Indonesian prisons will testify .

p.hi:
Is the Australian dollar 's near parrity with the US dollar a sign that the Australian economy is healthy , the US economy in chaos or both ?
"

p.s: This is too big a question to answer in any detail , except to say that rapid changes in the A$ are not healthy , and if it rises too high it will penalize our export industries , exacerbating the trade deficit .
The last thing we want is a return to the 1980s when the $A bounced around as a result of currency speculation .

p.hi: How do you rate the governments economic stimulus package ?

p.s: Overall , it was a necessary response .

hi.s: Dr Hamilton did n't answer this question

p.hi: Is the Carbon Pollution Reduction Scheme an effective sollution to climate change ? Why ?

p.s: The CPRS is a wholly inadequate and dangerous response to climate change .
The climate scientists say countries like Australia must cut emissions by 25-40 per cent by 2020 to have any chance of avoiding two degrees of warming .
If the world followed the Rudd plan we would experience four degrees or more , which would be catastrophic .
The Greens â€™ safe climate package is a proportionate response .
